intro: Guatteria synsepala, commonly known as the Mexican wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, reddish pulp. Guatteria synsepala is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
